Yes, it is essential that all perspectives and concerns are considered when developing regulations and guidelines for the use of gene-editing technology in agriculture. Policymakers should engage with a range of stakeholders, including farmers, environmentalists, consumer groups, and scientists, to gather different perspectives and insights.

Consumers in particular can play an important role in shaping the future of gene-editing technology in agriculture by demanding transparency, clear labeling, and regulation of the products they purchase. By engaging in open and honest dialogue with all stakeholders, policymakers can ensure that the use of gene-editing technology in agriculture is responsible, sustainable, and serves the interests of society at large.
